title: Chinese government donates humanitarian aid to Chad in 2010
description: On June 1 and June 4, 2010, Chinese government donated a batch of humanitarian aid supplies to Chad. The humanitarian aid materials include rice, tricycles for the disabled, towels, quilts, summer mats, rain cloths, solar stoves, etc. According to the agreement between the two parties, half of the batch of materials will be transferred to the Presidential Palace, and the other half will be transferred to the Ministry of Social Action, National Unity and Family.Ambassador to Chad Yang Guangyu and Chad Minister of Social Action, Ms. Carmel, co-chaired the handover ceremony of China’s humanitarian aid to Chad and signed the handover certificate.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese government donates humanitarian aid to Chad in 2010

# Description
On June 1 and June 4, 2010, Chinese government donated a batch of humanitarian aid supplies to Chad. The humanitarian aid materials include rice, tricycles for the disabled, towels, quilts, summer mats, rain cloths, solar stoves, etc. According to the agreement between the two parties, half of the batch of materials will be transferred to the Presidential Palace, and the other half will be transferred to the Ministry of Social Action, National Unity and Family.Ambassador to Chad Yang Guangyu and Chad Minister of Social Action, Ms. Carmel, co-chaired the handover ceremony of China’s humanitarian aid to Chad and signed the handover certificate.
justification: Humanitarian aid project focused on social welfare and emergency response, with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of humanitarian aid supplies including food, disability equipment, and basic living necessities

title: China awards Chinese Government Scholarships to Chadian students in 2010
description: In 2010, multiple students from Chad were awarded the 2010-2011 Chinese Government Scholarship. This helped finance each student's study abroad at various universities in China. The value of each scholarship is unknown.
staff_comments: Chinese project title: 2010年中国政府奖学金
combined_text:

EDUCATION

# Title
China awards Chinese Government Scholarships to Chadian students in 2010

# Description

justification: Scholarship program focused on education with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Education-focused scholarship program for Chadian students

title: Chinese government donates the fifth batch of anti-malaria drugs to Chad in 2010
description: On December 4, 2010, Chinese government donated anti-malaria drugs to the Ministry of Public Health of Chad. This is the fifth batch of antimalarial drugs provided by the Chinese government to Chad since the resumption of diplomatic relations between China and Chad. My Ambassador to Chad Yang Guangyu and Chad’s State Secretary of Public Health Muhammad Mamadou Adi signed the handover certificate on behalf of the two governments.
staff_comments: the fourth batch of anti-malarial drugs was donated the same year on January 21 (described in #56038).
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese government donates the fifth batch of anti-malaria drugs to Chad in 2010

# Description
On December 4, 2010, Chinese government donated anti-malaria drugs to the Ministry of Public Health of Chad. This is the fifth batch of antimalarial drugs provided by the Chinese government to Chad since the resumption of diplomatic relations between China and Chad. My Ambassador to Chad Yang Guangyu and Chad’s State Secretary of Public Health Muhammad Mamadou Adi signed the handover certificate on behalf of the two governments.
justification: Project is a healthcare donation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of anti-malaria drugs, healthcare focus

title: China donates US$1 million to Chile for earthquake disaster relief
description: On March 24, 2010, China donated US$1 million for earthquake relief efforts in Chile. The 8.8-magnitude quake killed 425 people and left 500,000 others homeless. Additionally, the earthquake caused about $30 billion USD of damage to buildings and infrastructure.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
China donates US$1 million to Chile for earthquake disaster relief

# Description
On March 24, 2010, China donated US$1 million for earthquake relief efforts in Chile. The 8.8-magnitude quake killed 425 people and left 500,000 others homeless. Additionally, the earthquake caused about $30 billion USD of damage to buildings and infrastructure.
justification: Project is focused on disaster relief and humanitarian aid without direct environmental or energy transition implications
evidence: Donation for earthquake relief, humanitarian focus, no energy or infrastructure development components

title: China sends 2 million USD worth of supplies to Chile for earthquake disaster relief
description: On March 5, 2010, a chartered plane from the Chinese Government arrived in Chile with 2 million USD worth of earthquake relief including 700 tents, 10,000 blankets, 100 portable generators and two water purifiers. This aid was in response to an 8.8-magnitude earthquake that struck Chile on February 27, 2010.   This project is linked to the 1 million USD grant China also sent following the earthquake in Chile (project ID #37013).
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
China sends 2 million USD worth of supplies to Chile for earthquake disaster relief

# Description
On March 5, 2010, a chartered plane from the Chinese Government arrived in Chile with 2 million USD worth of earthquake relief including 700 tents, 10,000 blankets, 100 portable generators and two water purifiers. This aid was in response to an 8.8-magnitude earthquake that struck Chile on February 27, 2010.   This project is linked to the 1 million USD grant China also sent following the earthquake in Chile (project ID #37013).
justification: Project is focused on humanitarian aid and disaster relief, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Earthquake relief supplies including tents, blankets, generators, and water purifiers

title: All-China Federation of Trade Unions donates $30,000 USD to the Workers' United Center of Chile to rebuild union building
description: In May 2010, All-China Federation of Trade Unions donated $30,000 USD to the Workers' United Center of Chile to rebuild the building of the trade union after it was damaged in the February 27 earthquake. While it appears that the donation was made, the trade union building was never fully reconstructed, and was demolished in 2017.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
All-China Federation of Trade Unions donates $30,000 USD to the Workers' United Center of Chile to rebuild union building

# Description
In May 2010, All-China Federation of Trade Unions donated $30,000 USD to the Workers' United Center of Chile to rebuild the building of the trade union after it was damaged in the February 27 earthquake. While it appears that the donation was made, the trade union building was never fully reconstructed, and was demolished in 2017.
justification: Project involves a donation for rebuilding a trade union building, which is unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Donation for rebuilding trade union building, no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: China Donates Scientific Equipment to Universities in Chile
description: In December 2010, the Chinese state councilor Lui Yandong signed an agreement to donate US$750,000 worth of scientific equipment to five Chilean universities that were rocked by the February 2010 earthquake. The equipment was said to be donated as part of an ongoing commitment from China to help Chile research and develop clean energy, biotechnology, astronomy, and seismology. According to data from the University of Chile, the awarded equipment was delivered on April 10th, and April 12th of 2012. The equipment included gas chromatograph, FT-IR spectrometer, binocular biological microscope, spectrophotometer.
staff_comments: The more conservative of the two figures mentioned in attached articles was coded as the transaction amount. The Chinese Embassy in Chile indicates an approximate value of 800,000 USD, while a Chilean news source indicates an approximate value of 750,000 USD. The English version of the Chilean news source incorrectly translates the original Spanish to 750 million, but the original Spanish indicates 750 thousand ('750 mil').
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China Donates Scientific Equipment to Universities in Chile

# Description
In December 2010, the Chinese state councilor Lui Yandong signed an agreement to donate US$750,000 worth of scientific equipment to five Chilean universities that were rocked by the February 2010 earthquake. The equipment was said to be donated as part of an ongoing commitment from China to help Chile research and develop clean energy, biotechnology, astronomy, and seismology. According to data from the University of Chile, the awarded equipment was delivered on April 10th, and April 12th of 2012. The equipment included gas chromatograph, FT-IR spectrometer, binocular biological microscope, spectrophotometer.
justification: Project focuses on educational support and scientific equipment donation without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of scientific equipment to universities, focus on education and research support

title: CDB contributes to a $150 million syndicated loan to Nextel Chile to finance telecommunications equipment
description: In December 2010, China Development Bank and HSBC Bank USA entered into a syndicated loan (equipment financing) agreement with Nextel Chile, authorizing Nextel Chile to borrow up to $150 million to finance equipment and certain other costs related to the deployment of its WCDMA network in Chile. This loan had a floating interest rate based on LIBOR plus 2.50% (2.81% as of December 31, 2012).  During the second quarter of 2013, the entire amount outstanding ($150 million) under Nextel Chile's loan was repaid by NII Holdings. Nextel Chile was originally a subsidiary mobile phone company of the US-based communications company of the same name, NII Holdings Inc.  In 2015, the company was acquired by a British firm, Novator Partners, and in July of that year, Nextel Chile was dissolved and rebranded as WOM (Word of Mouth).
staff_comments: 1. The exact size of CDB’s contribution is unknown. For the time being, AidData assumes that the 2 members of the lending syndicate contributed equally ($75 million) to the $150 million loan.
combined_text:
# Sector
COMMUNICATIONS

# Title
CDB contributes to a $150 million syndicated loan to Nextel Chile to finance telecommunications equipment

# Description
In December 2010, China Development Bank and HSBC Bank USA entered into a syndicated loan (equipment financing) agreement with Nextel Chile, authorizing Nextel Chile to borrow up to $150 million to finance equipment and certain other costs related to the deployment of its WCDMA network in Chile. This loan had a floating interest rate based on LIBOR plus 2.50% (2.81% as of December 31, 2012).  During the second quarter of 2013, the entire amount outstanding ($150 million) under Nextel Chile's loan was repaid by NII Holdings. Nextel Chile was originally a subsidiary mobile phone company of the US-based communications company of the same name, NII Holdings Inc.  In 2015, the company was acquired by a British firm, Novator Partners, and in July of that year, Nextel Chile was dissolved and rebranded as WOM (Word of Mouth).
justification: Project focuses on telecommunications equipment financing, which has no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Financing for WCDMA network deployment, telecommunications equipment focus

title: China and Russia provide aid to victims of flooding in Colombia
description: In 2010, Russia and China provided support to Colombia in light of intense rains that have left 303 dead and 2.2 million victims as a result of La Niña. The donation was announced on December 28, 2010 with the assurance that the donation would come the following day. On December 29, 2010 the both the Russian and Chinese donations were delivered. Russia provided 25 tonnes worth of humanitarian aid, and China donated $200,000 for emergency response efforts.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
China and Russia provide aid to victims of flooding in Colombia

# Description
In 2010, Russia and China provided support to Colombia in light of intense rains that have left 303 dead and 2.2 million victims as a result of La Niña. The donation was announced on December 28, 2010 with the assurance that the donation would come the following day. On December 29, 2010 the both the Russian and Chinese donations were delivered. Russia provided 25 tonnes worth of humanitarian aid, and China donated $200,000 for emergency response efforts.
justification: Humanitarian aid for emergency response to natural disaster
evidence: Donation of $200,000 and humanitarian aid for flood victims
